exercise.title: Calm Breathing
exercise.description: A simple 5-minute breathing exercise to reduce stress and promote relaxation. Focus on slow, deep breaths to activate your parasympathetic nervous system.

fragments: Welcome to this calm breathing exercise.
Find a comfortable seated position.
Allow your shoulders to relax and your hands to rest gently in your lap.
When you're ready, gently close your eyes or soften your gaze.
Breathe in slowly through your nose.
Notice the cool air as it enters.
Exhale gently through your mouth.
Feel your body softening with each breath.
Now let your breath deepen.
Breathe in for a count of five.
Exhale for a count of seven.
Allow any tension to melt away.
Now breathe naturally at your own pace.
Notice the gentle rhythm of your breath.
There's nowhere to go, nothing to do.
Just breathe and be present.
Begin to deepen your breath once more.
Gently wiggle your fingers and toes.
When you're ready, slowly open your eyes.
Thank you for taking this time to breathe.
Carry this sense of calm with you throughout your day.
